ai.summary: A 9.3 km moderate hike linking Hardy's Cottage with Max Gate in the UK. The route follows rural lanes and countryside paths, offering a pastoral exploration of Thomas Hardy's heritage with gentle elevation changes and scenic views.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily rural paths and country lanes with gravel, grass, and occasional mud. Expect uneven sections, gentle gradients, and exposure to wind on open farmland.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy boots and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on public rights of way, watch for livestock or farm traffic, and carry water and a snack. Bring a map or navigation device and tell someone your planned route and return time. Be cautious of muddy sections after rain and exposed stretches.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation on your phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring (Mar–May) and autumn (Sep–Nov) typically offer pleasant temperatures and scenery; summer (Jun–Aug) can be enjoyable but busier; winter hikes are possible on milder days but may be muddy with reduced daylight.

seo.title: Hardys Cottage to Max Gate: 9.3 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover a 9.3 km moderate hike from Hardy's Cottage to Max Gate in the UK. Enjoy rural lanes, countryside scenery, and connections to Thomas Hardy's literary heritage.
